ITC Hotels Demerger Live Updates: ITC shares trade ex-hotels; discovered price at ₹455.60 on NSE | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:
ITC Hotels Demerger Live Updates: ITC shares trade ex-hotels; discovered price at ₹455.60 on NSE

Date: 06 Jan 2025

Source: LiveMint

ITC Hotels demerger record date was today, and the discovered price of ITC shares during a special trading session on the NSE is ₹455.60 apiece.

  • ITC shares are trading ex-hotels as the demerger record date has formally been executed.
  • The stock was adjusted by ₹26 or 5.4% at ₹455.60 on NSE.
  • ITC Hotels demerger ratio is 1:10, meaning shareholders receive one share of ITC Hotels for every ten ITC shares held.
  • The listing date for ITC Hotels will be announced soon.
  • Expectations for ITC Hotels listing price range between ₹100-170 based on peer valuations.
“The demerger is expected to unlock substantial shareholder value and allow ITC Hotels to focus on growth.” - Prashanth Tapse, Senior VP (Research), Mehta Equities Ltd.

This demerger is a significant event for ITC Ltd shareholders, as it allows for direct investment in the growing hotel sector.
newTitle: ITC Hotels Demerger Update: ITC Shares Trading Ex-Hotels at ₹455.60

title: Redmi 14C 5G launched with 120 Hz refresh rate and Snapdragon processor for budget buyers in India - The Hindu
summary:
Redmi 14C 5G launched with 120 Hz refresh rate and Snapdragon processor for budget buyers in India

Date & Source: January 06, 2025 - The Hindu

Xiaomi has introduced its first smartphone of 2025, the budget-friendly Redmi 14C 5G, offering impressive specifications and features for cost-conscious consumers.

  • 6.88 inch HD+ punch hole display with 120 Hz refresh rate.
  • Powered by Snapdragon 4 Gen 2 processor with options up to 6 GB RAM and 128 GB storage.
  • Equipped with a 5,160 mAh battery with 33 W charger and supports 18 W charging.
  • Features a 50 MP camera and an 8 MP front camera.
  • Prices start at ₹9,999 for the base model, with the device available in three colors.
  • Sales begin on January 10 through various online platforms.
Xiaomi has priced the Redmi 14C 5G at ₹9,999 for 4 GB/64 GB, while the 4 GB/128 GB model will sell for ₹10,999 and the 6 GB/128 GB at ₹11,999.

The Redmi 14C 5G is positioned as a compelling option in the budget smartphone segment, offering high specifications at an accessible price.
newTitle: Redmi 14C 5G Launched: Affordable Smartphone with Impressive Features

title: ​6 Amazing Pictures Of Interacting Galaxies Captured By NASA Telescope ​ - Times Now
summary:
6 Amazing Pictures Of Interacting Galaxies Captured By NASA Telescope

Date: Jan 6, 2025 Source: Times Now

This article showcases stunning images of interacting galaxies captured by NASA's Hubble Space Telescope, highlighting their unique features and beauty.

  • Image of NGC 7049 showing a collection of globular clusters.
  • Portrait of Stephan’s Quintet, a group of five galaxies including a foreground galaxy.
  • NGC 5128 known for its dramatic dark lanes of dusty material.
  • NGC 3717, a beautiful spiral galaxy located about 60 million light-years away.
  • NGC 1316, depicting the results of a merger between two galaxies.
  • Arp 148 showing a ring-shaped galaxy involved in a collision.
“It has intricate loops and blobs of cosmic dust, evidence of past galactic mergers.”

This collection of images emphasizes the complexity and dynamic nature of our universe as seen through NASA's advanced technologies.

Indian equity benchmarks extended morning losses in the mid-market session, with foreign portfolio investors continuing their selling spree as traders awaited Q3 earnings season cues.

The main points highlighted in this article include:

  • Foreign institutional investors sold ₹4,227.25 crore in capital markets on Friday.
  • SENSEX traded down by 0.95% at 78530.57, while NIFTY50 fell 1.01% to 23764.85.
  • The broader indices were also in decline; BSE mid-cap down 1.27%, small-cap down 1.64%.
  • HDFC Bank shares dropped due to slowed credit growth updates.
  • Titan shares rallied over 2% backed by strong Q3FY25 growth, with a 24% YoY revenue increase.
  • Asian markets mostly traded in the red, with some noteworthy declines in major indices.
“Investors are wary of taking on more risk in light of looming US-China trade tensions.”

title: India Suffer Big Jasprit Bumrah Blow Ahead Of England Series, Report Says Pacer To Miss... - NDTV Sports
summary:
Jasprit Bumrah Likely to Miss England Series Due to Back Injury

Date: January 25, 2025 | Source: NDTV

India's pace spearhead Jasprit Bumrah is likely to miss a significant portion of the upcoming white-ball series against England due to back spasms. The decision to rest him aims to ensure his recovery ahead of the ICC Champions Trophy starting February 19.

  • Bumrah was instrumental in the recently concluded Border-Gavaskar Trophy, taking 32 wickets.
  • Concerns arise from his high workload during the series, where he bowled over 150 overs.
  • The BCCI medical team is assessing the severity of his injury to plan recovery.
  • If classified as a Grade 1 injury, Bumrah could be sidelined for 2-3 weeks, while Grade 2 could mean a 6-week recovery.
  • India is scheduled to face England in five T20Is and three ODIs starting January 22.
“His presence is mandatory to India's fortunes,” sources say about Bumrah's role in the Champions Trophy.

The outcome of the injury assessment will determine Bumrah's participation in the series against England and his fitness for the upcoming matches.
newTitle: Jasprit Bumrah Likely to Miss England Series Due to Back Injury

summary:
Two Babies Diagnosed With HMPV Virus In Bengaluru

Publication Date: Today Source: The Centre

The report highlights two cases of Human Metapneumovirus (HMPV) in Bengaluru, marking the first occurrences in India. One of the infants has been discharged, while the other is still recovering.

  • 3-month-old and 8-month-old babies diagnosed with HMPV.
  • No recent travel history for affected families.
  • HMPV monitoring initiated by ICMR and related health bodies.
  • Health Ministry convened a meeting for preparedness against HMPV.
  • The virus can lead to mild respiratory symptoms but may cause serious complications.
“Both cases were identified through routine surveillance for multiple respiratory viral pathogens...” - Centre statement

The monitoring of HMPV and respiratory viruses is crucial, especially in light of the increase in respiratory illnesses observed in other regions.
newTitle: Two Babies Diagnosed With HMPV Virus In Bengaluru

Meta moves NCLAT against ₹213.14 crore CCI penalty over WhatsApp privacy policy - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
summary:
Meta Appeals ₹213.14 Crore CCI Penalty Over WhatsApp Privacy Policy

Published on: 06 Jan 2025, 5:53 am

Meta Platforms Inc has filed an appeal with the NCLAT against a ₹213.14 crore penalty imposed by the CCI for abuses related to its WhatsApp privacy policy.

  1. Meta is contesting a CCI penalty regarding its WhatsApp privacy policy.
  2. The penalty amounts to ₹213.14 crore for abusing market dominance.
  3. Senior Advocates Kapil Sibal and Mukul Rohatgi are representing Meta and WhatsApp.
  4. The NCLAT is set to hear the case on January 16.
  5. The CCI found that WhatsApp's 2021 policy violated the Competition Act.
  6. Citing a 'take-it-or-leave-it' approach, the CCI deemed user autonomy undermined.

“The order has huge implications. We request your lordships to take it up yourself.”

In conclusion, the outcome of this case may have significant ramifications for WhatsApp and the broader tech industry regarding data sharing practices.
newTitle: Meta Appeals ₹213.14 Crore CCI Penalty Over WhatsApp Privacy Policy

title: Stock market crash: Sensex cracks 1200 points, Nifty 50 below 23,700; HMPV virus scare among 5 factors behind selloff | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:
Stock market crash: Sensex cracks 1200 points, Nifty 50 below 23,700; HMPV virus scare among 5 factors behind selloff

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Live Mint

The Indian stock market witnessed a significant crash on Monday, with both Sensex and Nifty 50 indices falling over a percent due to investor fears sparked by a new virus outbreak in China. The Sensex dropped over 1,100 points, while Nifty 50 slipped below the 23,700 mark.

  • Sectoral indices, including Nifty PSU Bank and Nifty Realty, experienced major losses.
  • Top losers included Tata Steel, BPCL, and Adani Enterprises.
  • The fall attributed to weak Asian markets, a virus outbreak, heavy losses in index heavyweights, strength of the US dollar, and broken technical support levels.
“Nifty holds a good view until it stays above its 200 DMA which is placed at 23,900.” - Prashanth Tapse, Senior VP (Research), Mehta Equities Ltd.

Analysts suggest caution as the market reacts to geopolitical uncertainties and technical resistance levels.
newTitle: Stock Market Crash: Sensex Drops 1200 Points Amid HMPV Virus Concerns

Date: Jan 06, 2025

The trailer for the film Emergency, featuring Kangana Ranaut as former Prime Minister Indira Gandhi, has been released. The trailer portrays key historical events during the Emergency period in India.

  • Kangana portrays Indira Gandhi declaring herself the Cabinet.
  • Anupam Kher plays Jayaprakash Narayan, who communicates with Gandhi from jail.
  • The film depicts portrayal of violence and chaos during the Emergency.
  • Kangana tweeted about the film highlighting the historical significance of the Emergency and Gandhi's influence.

  • The film is set to release on January 17, 2025.
“1975, Emergency — A Defining chapter in Indian History. Indira: India’s most powerful woman. Her ambition transformed the nation, but her #EMERGENCY plunged it into chaos.” - Kangana Ranaut

High drama outside Telangana ACB office as KTR refuses to go in without lawyer, calls CM Revanth Reddy ‘third-rate criminal’ - The Indian Express
summary:
High drama outside Telangana ACB office as KTR refuses to go in without lawyer, calls CM Revanth Reddy ‘third-rate criminal’

Publication Date: Monday

Source: [Your News Source]

On Monday morning, K T Rama Rao, the working president of Bharat Rashtra Samiti, found himself in a standoff with the Telangana Anti Corruption Bureau. He refused to enter the ACB office without his lawyer present, leading to significant drama outside the agency’s premises.

  • KTR stated that the ACB barred his lawyer from attending while his statement was recorded.
  • After 45 minutes in their vehicle, KTR left without giving his statement, having submitted a lawyer's response to the ACB notice.
  • He asserted his right to have legal representation during questioning, citing concerns over trust towards the ACB and past incidents involving other politicians.
  • The ACB had summoned him regarding the Formula E race case, linked to an alleged financial transfer to a foreign company.
  • KTR has challenged the ACB's FIR against him in the High Court, which has yet to issue a ruling.
“I do not trust this government and the police are acting under the instructions of a third-rate criminal like Revanth Reddy,” KTR claimed.

The situation has raised questions about legal rights and procedural integrity as KTR awaits further developments in his case.
newTitle: Standoff at Telangana ACB Office: KTR Questions Legal Proceedings

summary:
First HMPV Cases Reported in India: Two Infants in Bengaluru Test Positive

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Times of India

This article discusses the first reported cases of human metapneumovirus (HMPV) in India, specifically in Bengaluru, where two infants have tested positive.

  • HMPV is known to cause respiratory infections.
  • The affected infants are currently receiving treatment and are being monitored.
  • Health officials are urging the public to be vigilant in recognizing symptoms.
  • Awareness campaigns are being planned to educate parents about HMPV.
"It's crucial for parents to watch for respiratory symptoms in their children and seek medical help if necessary."

The emergence of HMPV cases in India highlights the need for heightened awareness and preparedness in handling respiratory infections, particularly among young children.

HMPV: 8-month-old at Bengaluru hospital suspected to have tested positive - Hindustan Times
summary:
Infant in Bengaluru Suspected to Test Positive for HMPV

Date: Jan 06, 2025 Source: HT News

An eight-month-old infant in Bengaluru is suspected to have tested positive for Human Metapneumovirus (HMPV). The family reported no recent travel history and showed no symptoms of concern.

  • The infant's sample was collected on January 2.
  • Health department officials have acknowledged the lab findings but have not independently verified them.
  • HMPV primarily affects children and is associated with about 0.7% of flu cases globally.
  • There are ongoing concerns about HMPV in relation to outbreaks in China.
“We trust the accuracy of their testing procedures,” a health department official stated.

While there is speculation about the virus, health authorities report no immediate cause for alarm.
newTitle: Infant in Bengaluru Suspected to Test Positive for HMPV

title: 8-month-old at Bengaluru hospital is first suspected HMPV case in India - Hindustan Times
summary:
Bengaluru Hospital Reports First Suspected Case of HMPV in India

Date: Jan 06, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

An eight-month-old infant is suspected to have tested positive for Human Metapneumovirus (HMPV) at a hospital in Bengaluru. The infant's family has no recent travel history and shows no concerning symptoms.

  • The infant's sample was collected on January 2, 2025.
  • The state health department has not verified the results but trusts the private facility's testing accuracy.
  • HMPV is known to primarily affect children and is present in approximately 0.7% of global flu cases.
  • Health officials in Karnataka have stated they lack detailed information on the specific strain.
  • There are current concerns regarding HMPV's spread in China, but health authorities claim there is nothing to alarm about.
“We trust the accuracy of their testing procedures,” - health department official.

This case marks a significant development in public health as the first suspected instance of HMPV in India, highlighting the need for awareness and monitoring of respiratory infections, especially with ongoing concerns about viral outbreaks globally.
newTitle: Bengaluru Hospital Reports First Suspected Case of HMPV in India

title: Tamil Nadu Governor R.N. Ravi walks out of Assembly without reading customary address - The Hindu
summary:
Tamil Nadu Governor R.N. Ravi Walks Out of Assembly Session

Date: January 06, 2025 Source: The Hindu

Tamil Nadu Governor R.N. Ravi left the Assembly without delivering his customary address due to a conflict regarding the playing of the national anthem.

  • The Governor insisted that the national anthem should be played after the state anthem, which did not happen.
  • Raj Bhavan criticized the Assembly for not respecting the national anthem, describing the incident as an insult to the Constitution.
  • The Governor remained in the House for only three minutes before leaving in protest.
  • After his departure, the main opposition party protested, demanding justice for a recent sexual assault incident at a university.
  • This incident marks the second consecutive Assembly session where the Governor has walked out.
“The Constitution of Bharat and the National Anthem were once again insulted in the Tamil Nadu Assembly today.” - Raj Bhavan Statement

The controversy surrounding the Governor's exit reinforces tensions between state officials and the Governor's office on ceremonial matters.
newTitle: Tamil Nadu Governor R.N. Ravi Walks Out of Assembly Session

title: Tamil Nadu Governor walks out of Assembly without reading address - The Hindu
summary:
Tamil Nadu Governor R.N. Ravi walks out of Assembly without reading customary address

Date: January 06, 2025 | Source: The Hindu

Tamil Nadu Governor R.N. Ravi departed the State Assembly session on January 6, 2025, without delivering his customary address after expressing his dissatisfaction over the national anthem not being played following the State anthem.

  • The Governor insisted on the national anthem being played but it was not.
  • The Raj Bhavan stated that the incident was an insult to the Constitution and the National Anthem.
  • Mr. Ravi was present for only about three minutes before leaving the House.
  • After his departure, AIADMK members held protests regarding a sexual assault case at Anna University.
  • This is not the first time the Governor has walked out of the Assembly; similar incidents occurred in February 2024 and January 2023.
“Not to be a party to such brazen disrespect to the Constitution and the National Anthem, Governor in deep anguish left the House.”

The incident raises serious questions about the respect for constitutional duties within the Assembly, echoing previous instances of conflict between the Governor and the government.
newTitle: Tamil Nadu Governor R.N. Ravi leaves Assembly without delivering address over anthem dispute
